Posts.Content: kathyv wrote: I had a port placed 3 weeks ago.  I have not seen my dr yet, the port was used for the first time yesterday.  Today I noticed that veins in my chest, arm, and even my reconstructed breast are all dialated and the side of my neck that the port is on is very sore.  Is this normal?  Any advice?  Thanks so much, Kathy Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: recent port placement question kathyv kathyv

Posts.Content: kathyv wrote: Hi Guys,  Has anyone tried rebounding for lymphadema?  I was reading that it really helps move extracellular fluid.  Thanks, Kathy Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: rebounding kathyv BoobsinaBox

Posts.Content: kathyv wrote: I go see the oncologist today.  The onco type test showed that I have an 8% risk of recurrence with no chemo and 3.5% if I do it.  I just really need to decide if an 8% risk is worth doing chemo for.  The oncologist says no, my husband says no, but both of my daughters think it is.  I just don't know.  I have been battling a pseudonomas infection since my surgery 6 weeks ago so I know part of the reason I am having trouble deciding is because I already feel like crap and can't imagine feeling worse for the next 4-6 months.  Thanks fo any input, Kathy Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Do you think an 8% risk of recurrance is worth doing chemo? kathyv riverinerabbit
Do you think an 8% risk of recurrance is worth doing chemo? kathyv riverinerabbit

Posts.Content: kathyv wrote: Hello Everyone- I am 2 months post bilateral mastectomy and immediate DIEP reconstruction.  I have been having pain and swelling on my upper abdomen.  I read the post about truncal lymphadema and bought the barely there shaping camisoles.  They helped so much.  I just wanted to say thank you to all of you.  Being able to learn from all of you really makes getting through this easier. Thanks again- Kathy Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: huge thank you kathyv xmasprops
